description.narrative: The first project component focuses on the implementation of the Egyptian Prevention of Early Marriage Strategy. With technical assistance from Pathfinder International, the NPC of Egypt successfully developed the Prevention of Early Marriage National Strategy, which will be integrated into Egypt’s Population Strategy. The strategy focuses on improving the socioeconomic, cultural, educational, and health conditions of young people in Egypt, especially girls, as the means to create an enabling environment for empowering young girls and boys. Pathfinder will now work with the NPC to replicate the implementation of the Egyptian Prevention of Early Marriage National Strategy across all governorates of Egypt. The second project component will focus on strengthening school-based health education for adolescent girls. Building on the success of the Ford Foundation-funded I Know, I Decide project; Pathfinder will work to improve adolescent secondary school girls’ (ages 15-18) knowledge and attitudes in relation to key SRH issues, leaving them better prepared to protect their SRH throughout the lifecycle. Pathfinder will expand this work to additional girls’ schools in Alexandria in collaboration with the Health Insurance Authority and will begin replicating the program in Matrouh governorate.

With support from the Ford Foundation, Pathfinder will continue its work in Egypt to address the sexual and reproductive health (SRH) needs of adolescents and youth. Pathfinder International will work with the National Population Council (NPC) and the Health Insurance Authority in Egypt. Working through two distinct, but complimentary project components, Pathfinder aims to improve access to SRH and rights information and services for young people in Egypt.
